intro: Pseudixora sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran pseudixora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
